channel.title: Downloadable client help!
channel.description: Hi I just made a server and i want a downloadable client to put on mediafire.com can you please give me a tutorial? THANK YOU

item.title: Downloadable client help!
item.dc:creator: @_onster мonster
item.description:
@_onster wrote:

You can delete the .java files, select the compression rate to “Best” before selecting “Ok” via the “Add to archive…” window and more than likely delete unused files from the cache, but don’t mess about with it if you don’t know what you’re doing.

If your client is between 20-50MB then I’d say it’s acceptable. Anything over 100MB is unacceptable. Inbetween is just… meh.

Read full topic

item.title: Downloadable client help!

item.description:
@ghostly150 wrote:

Mediafire is the best! It’s free and you don’t have to wait to download a file.

Read full topic

item.title: Downloadable client help!
item.dc:creator: @_onster мonster
item.description:
@_onster wrote:

First make sure you have a client that is compatible with your server. Then download and install winRAR, so that you can compress the files, ready for uploading.

http://www.win-rar.com/download.html

You can compress the clients folder by right clicking on the client folder and selecting “Add to archive…”, then click “Ok”.

Lastly, go to http://www.mediafire.com/ and follow the on screen instructions. You can just drag and drop the compressed version of the client on to the green box on the home page.

After the upload is complete, MediaFire will provide you with a link. This is the link you tell everybody to download from.

Let me know if you get stuck.

Read full topic
